sentences.english: He sat by the corpse all night, weeping in bitter earnest.
sentences.chinese: 他整夜坐在屍體旁邊，真摯地苦苦悲泣。

sentences.english: Instead seek inspiration from those before you and the world around you.
sentences.chinese: 用前人的創造和你身邊的東西取代苦苦探尋靈感。

sentences.english: He refused to hold her hand though she begged.
sentences.chinese: 儘管她苦苦哀求，他也沒有手下留情。

sentences.english: No one likes getting stuck in a mile-long bottleneck on the freeway when you're going to work.
sentences.chinese: 沒有人喜歡在上班路上因塞車而苦苦等候。

sentences.english: She implored piteously a voice choked with sobs.
sentences.chinese: 她用哽咽了的嗓音苦苦哀求。

sentences.english: When she begs you not to go, there's one thing you should know.
sentences.chinese: 當她苦苦哀求你留下，有一件事你要明白。

sentences.english: I asked Baobao, Tiantian and other little friends to come to my party.
sentences.chinese: 我請了寶寶，苦苦戰其他小朋友去到場我的死日散會。

sentences.english: You had my heart of stone, not in the full moon night languish.
sentences.chinese: 你煉就了我的鐵石心腸，不會在月圓的夜苦苦期盼。

sentences.english: Beg hard in me issued her to just write a sale note .
sentences.chinese: 在我苦苦相求下她才寫了個售貨單。

sentences.english: He plodded the streets all day looking for work.
sentences.chinese: 他爲了尋找工作而在街上苦苦地跑了一整天。

sentences.english: Her mother laborious sews the cotton fabric.
sentences.chinese: 她的母親辛辛苦苦的縫製棉織品。

sentences.english: Prince Zhi has loved me madly for years.
sentences.chinese: 公子治已經苦苦的愛了我很多年。

sentences.english: John plodded away at the work all night but couldn't finish it.
sentences.chinese: 約翰苦苦幹了一整夜，但還是沒有把工作幹完。

sentences.english: I pondered this sentence painfully, after he was gone.
sentences.chinese: 在他走後，我苦苦地思索着這句話。

sentences.english: No wonder parents agonise over what names to give their babies.
sentences.chinese: 怪不得父母們爲給寶寶們取什麼名字而苦苦思索。

sentences.english: We are not supposed to play ducks and drakes with the hard-earned money of our parents.
sentences.chinese: 我們不應隨意濫用父母辛辛苦苦掙來的錢。

definition: to do one's utmost/with all one's might/at all costs/(to work or fight) as if one's life depends on it
to dither/to hesitate/to pace back and forth/by ext. to hover around/to linger
to look for/to seek/to find fault
to think hard/bitter thoughts/to pour out one's sufferings
to struggle on whilst at death's door (idiom)
to despair/to give up all hope/desperate/desperation
survival/the struggle to eke out a living/to seek for continued existence
